list.author: Tyler Schiffman - United States
list.title: Burst
list.description: California sea lion framed by kelp beds in Monterey Bay, California. Grand Prize Winner for 2019 TNC Global Photo Contest.

list.author: Diyanto Sarira - Indonesia
list.title: Wanayo Waterfall
list.description: A small waterfall and stream in Wasior, West Papua.

list.author: Fernando O’Farrill - Mexico
list.title: Hope
list.description: Polar Bear in Svalbard, Norway June 2019.

list.author: Raymond Hennessy - United States
list.title: Singing Silhouette
list.description: A Chestnut-sided Warbler sings out.

list.author: Yaron Schmid - United States
list.title: The Grevy's Illusion
list.description: A Grevy's zebra staring at the camera in Lewa, Kenya.

list.author: José David Altamirano González - Costa Rica
list.title: Africa Salvaje
list.description: Botswana, July 2019

list.author: Giuseppe Bonali - Italy
list.title: The Trio
list.description: Three damselflies after a storm in Italy.

list.author: Sebastian Di Domenico - Colombia
list.title: Bizarre Looks
list.description: A White-Tipped Sicklebill stand completely still as hummingbirds lower their metabolism during night time to avoid starvation.

list.author: Le Van Vinh - Vietnam
list.title: Dance in the Sea
list.description: Fisherman in Hon Yen, Phu Yen, Vietnam.

list.author: Fabio Teixeira - Brazil
list.title: Portrait in Guanabara Bay
list.description: A young African refugee from the Democratic Republic of Congo floating in the waters of Guanabara Bay, Ramos Beach.

list.author: Apratim Pal - India
list.title: Bathing Time
list.description: Two swimmers enjoy the water. West Bengal, India.

list.author: Giovani Cordioli - Brazil
list.title: Cuban Storm
list.description: A storm comes over Varadero, Cuba, 2019.

list.author: Anskar Lenzen - Germany
list.title: Refreshment
list.description: A jump into the iconic lake Eibsee in southern Germany on a hot summer day.

list.author: Ted Somerville - United States
list.title: Copacabana Surfer
list.description: A surfer enjoying a good wave in Copacabana.

list.author: Jay Huang - United States
list.title: Golden Gate Bridge Alignment
list.description: Golden Gate Bridge during a low fog event.

list.author: Yevhen Samuchenko - Ukraine
list.title: Gold of Svaneti
list.description: Mestia, a small city in Georgia, at night.

list.author: Robert Potts - United States
list.title: California Sea Lions
list.description: Docks in Astoria taken over by California Sea Lions.

list.author: Tsz Ho Tse - Hong Kong
list.title: Morning Hong Kong
list.description: The view of the world famous Victoria Harbour under the clouds in the early morning.

list.author: Alex Kydd - Australia
list.title: Big Fish in a Big Ocean
list.description: A whale shark swimming in the depths off of Ningaloo Reef, Western Australia.

list.author: Hao Jiang - United States
list.title: To the Lightning
list.description: A flock of flamingos fly over the colorful salt lake, the floating foam pattern looks like lightning on the lake.

list.author: Alex Kydd
list.title: A Rare Encounter With Cownose Rays
list.description: A large grouping of Cownose Rays (Rhinoptera bonasus) taken on Ningaloo Reef, Western Australia.

list.author: Barbara Rot - Slovenia
list.title: Iceberg
list.description: Adelie penguin on an iceberg.

list.author: Michael Gallagher - United Kingdom
list.title: Gimme Shelter
list.description: An anemonefish shelters in the tentacles of a closed up reef anemone.

list.author: Colin Ronald - Austria
list.title: Taking The Plunge
list.description: Skier heading down a mountain slope in Slovenia.

list.author: Leigh Miller - Australia
list.title: Pink Lake
list.description: Drone photo showing the pink hues of a pink lake called Hutt Lagoon, Western Australia.

list.author: Guilherme Gomes de Mesquita - Brazil
list.title: On the Brink
list.description: Trolltunga, Norway.

list.author: Carlos Eduardo Goulart
list.title: Paine Grande in the Storm
list.description: Torres Del Paine National Park in Chile. January, 2019.

list.author: Victor Grilo Lima - Brazil
list.title: Piedras Rojas
list.description: Sunset at Piedras Rojas in the Atacama Desert in Chile.

list.author: Florian LeDoux - France
list.title: Tree of Life
list.description: Water in quicksand, Iceland.

list.author: José David Altamirano González - Costa Rica
list.title: Furia
list.description: Volcán De Fuego

list.author: Anup Shah
list.title: Malui
list.description: Western lowland gorilla female 'Malui' walking through a cloud of butterflies she has disturbed in a bai. Bai Hokou, Dzanga Sangha Special Dense Forest Reserve, Central African Republic. December 2011.

list.author: Prathamesh Ghadekar
list.title: Fireflies
list.description: Just before Monsoon, these fireflies congregate in certain regions of India and on a few special trees like this one, they are in crazy quantity which can range in millions.

list.author: Daniel De Granville Manço
list.title: Drought
list.description: Carcass of a Pantanal alligator (Caiman yacare) in the dry soil on the banks of the Transpantaneira highway, municipality of Poconé (Mato Grosso).

list.author: Denis Ferreira Netto
list.title: Serra do Mar
list.description: In a helicopter flight through the sea mountain range, I came across this white cloud cover, which resulted in this magnificent image that resembles the head of a dinosaur.

list.author: Jassen Todorov
list.title: Salt Ponds
list.description: If you have flown into San Francisco International Airport, you may have seen these colorful salt ponds over the bay. This aerial image was taken while flying my plane.

list.author: Scott Portelli, Australia
list.title: Life Colour
list.description: Lush green mangroves line the mud flats accentuated by the tidal waters and months of rain filling the artesian basin. Gulf of Carpentaria in tropical north Queensland.

list.author: Kim-pan Dennis Wong
list.title: Hong Kong
list.description: At Hung Hom, the rising of full moon could be found every month thanks to its facing the east.

list.author: Alain Schroeder
list.title: Saving Orangutans
list.description: The whole SOCP team works together to prepare Brenda, an estimated 3-month-old female orangutan (she has no teeth yet), for surgery.

list.author: Tom Overall
list.title: Sand Storm
list.description: A guide in the Sahara Desert enduring a sand storm.

list.author: Sebnem Coskun
list.title: Covid-19 Waste
list.description: New danger to underwater life as medical waste used during the pandemic reaches the seas.

list.author: Minqiang Lu
list.title: The Way Home
list.description: In Yunnan, China. May 2021.

list.author: Wax Leung
list.title: Space of HK
list.description: Hong Kong.

list.author: Kazi Arifujjaman
list.title: Water
list.description: Water and people.

list.author: Joram Mennes
list.title: Swimming
list.description: Three levels of leisure: swimmers, freedivers and divers enjoy their respective sport/recreational activities in a Fresh Water mass know locally as the Cenotes.

list.author: Man Wai Wong
list.title: Winter
list.description: Iceland, 2019.

list.author: Jorge Andrés Miraglia
list.title: Glacial Bubbles
list.description: As temperatures rise and glacial ice melts, air is released and caught inside. This air bubbles were caught by a frozen layer on top.

list.author: Manh Cuong Vu
list.title: Summer on the Lotus Pond
list.description: The lotus ponds across Vietnam are entering the growing season, flourishing.

list.author: Buddhilini de Soyza
list.title: A turbulent swim
list.description: Five male cheetahs, were looking to cross this river in powerful currents. It seemed a task doomed to failure and we were delighted when they made it to the other side.

list.author: Mateusz Piesiak
list.title: Sunflowers
list.description: This year due to a high water level a giant field of sunflowers could not been mown. In winter it attracted thousands of different species of birds.

list.author: Viktor Vrbovsky
list.title: Fishing
list.description: Pike has caught a large perch. How did it end up? I don’t know. The situation hasn’t changed much in an hour. I had to emerge because I was running out of air.

list.author: Kristhian Castro
list.title: Waiting
list.description: Galapagos sea lion calf (Zalophus wollebaeki), waiting for its mother in the sand on the beach, San Cristóbal Island, Galapagos, Ecuador.

list.author: Thomas Vijayan
list.title: Searching
list.description: Orangutans are accustomed to live on trees and feed on wild fruits like lychees, mangosteens, and figs, and slurp water from holes in trees.

list.author: Anup Shah
list.title: Wildebeest herd on the move
list.description: Maasai Mara National Reserve, Kenya. During the frenzy of crossing the Mara River, the wildebeests were leaping, kicking, scampering and bucking.

list.author: Li Ping
list.title: Branching Out
list.description: On either side of a highway, gullies formed by rainwater erosion span out like a tree in Tibet, an autonomous region in southwest China.

list.author: Shafeeq Mulla
list.title: An Unforgiving kingdom
list.description: A leopard known as Olimba carries the carcass of a female vervet monkey with its baby still hanging on for dear life. Picture taken in South Luangwa National Park in Zambia.

list.author: Florian Ledoux
list.title: Breastfeeding in town
list.description: A female polar bear breastfeeding her two cubs of the year in the harbour of the abandoned Russian settlement, Pyramiden.

list.author: Francisco Javier Munuera González
list.title: Adi
list.description: Slope of Mount Adi, in Navarra.

list.author: Hendy Wicaksono
list.title: Mystical Bromo
list.description: Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park (TNBTS) is one of the 10 priority tourist destinations in Indonesia.

list.author: Ivan Pedretti
list.title: Difference
list.description: Winter in Stokksnes on the beach with black sand and the majestic mountain, Vestrahorn.

list.author: Waluya Priya Atmaja
list.title: Mangrove Tree
list.description: This photo was taken in Lamongan, East Java at sunset. Mangroves were planted to reduce the impact of abrasion around this area.

list.author: Effy Varley
list.title: Reflection
list.description: The mist slowly thinned giving a glimpse of the trees on the other side, I grabbed my tripod to set up this shot.

list.author: Janusz Jurek
list.title: Rest
list.description: The photo was taken in Greece. A huge factory broke into the sea, taking the beach away from restful people. A simple, ordinary scene is very symbolic for me.

list.author: Komang Arnawa
list.title: abundant nets
list.description: Sorting activities of fishermen’s catches in the village of Kedonganan, Bali.

list.author: Francesca Franchini
list.title: The passage of the Mayan Train
list.description: The jungle of the Yucatan Peninsula protects a great biodiversity of species. The Mayan Train will be built here, affecting the best preserved jungle in the country.

list.author: Giovani Cordioli
list.title: The Storm is coming
list.description: I was at Varadero beach, Cuba when I saw this huge cloud coming, then I ran to the room and brought my camera to capture it.

list.author: Amish Jain
list.title: Faith above everything
list.description: A man standing in freezing cold water waiting for Sun God to arrive during Chatth Puja Festival.

list.author: Marvin Mwarangu
list.title: Wildlife intervention
list.description: As the mother is sedated, a veterinarian works quickly to diagnose and treat an elephant calf wound. The image was taken at the Ol Pejeta Conservancy on July 20, 2022.

list.author: Marcelo Paulo Silva
list.title: Post lockdown beach
list.description: Praia do Pontal, at Recreio dos Bandeirantes in Rio de Janeiro on the first day after the beaches lockdown.

list.author: Sandesh Kadur
list.title: Lizards and Windmills
list.description: A fan-throated lizard stands guard over his territory. Photographed in Satara's Chalkewadi plateau, which is the site of one of the largest wind farms in this region.

list.author: Amish Jain
list.title: Cleaning the Lakes
list.description: A person cleaning the Lakes of excessive sea vegetation due to hot climate as well as waste being dumped into the lake.

list.author: Jassen Todorov
list.title: Making Paper
list.description: Wastewater ponds are necessary yet dangerous. The leaking or deliberate discharging of inadequately treated water has polluted freshwater and saltwater ecosystems.

list.author: Ziaul Huque
list.title: Between Life & Death
list.description: Every road construction worker of Bangladesh who works in a construction site is severely damaged by black smoke and dust.

list.author: Marcelo Perez del Carpio
list.title: The Tucabaca's night
list.description: Volunteer forest firefighter Daniel Vargas Osinaga (21) walks through thick smoke after helping to extinguish a fire in Bolivia's Santa Rosa de Tucabaca.

list.author: Jassen Todorov
list.title: It's dry and dangerous out west
list.description: This image portrays the devastation caused by the Dixie fire, California's largest single wildfire.

list.author: Florian Ledoux
list.title: Two worlds
list.description: Aerial view of two different types of ice in winter. On the right side, the well established fast ice. On the left, the open water refreezing after a storm took away the ice.

list.author: Kristin Wright
list.title: Braided River
list.description: Brightly colored sediment paints the Icelandic landscape as at flows towards the ocean. The glacial river, Þjórsá, is the longest river in Iceland.

list.author: Nick Leopold Sordo
list.title: Las Coloradas, Yucatán
list.description: Las Coloradas salt mines in Yucatan. In these pink water lagoons is one of the most important salt generating plants in the country.

list.author: Dasun Nirmala Malaarachchi
list.title: Sea waves
list.description: Bluewater, golden sand, white foam mixed with bright sunlight paints gorgeous design under the Seacliff bridge in NSW, Australia.

list.author: Tom Shlesinger
list.title: Goliath in Lilliput
list.description: Decades ago, following severe declines in populations of Goliath Grouper, Florida banned their fishing, leading to an increase in the population.

list.author: Tom Fenske
list.title: Thor's Well
list.description: Also known as the Drainpipe of the Pacific, this natural hole in the rock along the Oregon Coast is seen here at sunset.

list.author: Callie Chee
list.title: Ghost Mushrooms
list.description: Nicknamed ghost mushrooms due to its eerie green glow, the scientific names of these bioluminescent mushrooms are Omphalotus Nidiformis.

list.author: Xiaoling Keller
list.title: Soaptree Yucca
list.description: Soaptree Yucca in White Sands National Park, New Mexico.

list.author: Tibor Litauszki
list.title: Crocus wave
list.description: Crocuses in the twilight.

list.author: Patrick Krohn
list.title: Balance
list.description: Dew drops balance on this purple heart flower on an early morning in in the spring of 2022 in my front yard in Aiken, SC, USA.

list.author: Jake Virus
list.title: The Last Truffula Tree
list.description: Deep in Ba Vi National Park in Vietnam sits a beautiful, yet spooky, forest.

list.author: Cristiano Xavier
list.title: Dragon Blood Trees
list.description: Dragon Blood Trees in a long exposure night photo. These trees grow only in the high plateaus of Socotra Island.

list.author: Cristiano Xavier
list.title: Ancient
list.description: An old tree of Madeira Island light painted in a foggy evening. This forest grows in a high part of the island and has some amazing mossy trees.

list.author: Anup Shah
list.title: Morani and Friend
list.description: Maasai Mara, Kenya. The lion on the right is distinctly older than its youthful companion. The old guy is one of the Four Musketeers that ruled Mara long time ago.

list.author: Panos Laskarakis
list.title: Giant in dust
list.description: The African dust around the supergiant is one of the best spectacles in wild Namibia.

list.author: Tibor Litauszki
list.title: Follow me
list.description: Deer at dawn blue.

list.author: Baiju Patil
list.title: Keep Distance
list.description: India.

list.author: Torie Hilley
list.title: A Giant's Ballet
list.description: During my time studying the African painted dog in South Africa, we came across these two young bull giraffes “necking” – which is their form of sparring or fighting.

list.author: Rick Dowling
list.title: The Battle
list.description: The eagles were fighting for a piece of salmon. The eagle on top flew on top of the second eagle to try and get the salmon. Photographed at the Eagle Fest at Haines, AK.

list.author: Masahiro Hiroike
list.title: HIMEBOTARU
list.description: Nanbu Town, Tottori Prefecture, Japan. "Himebotaru" is a small firefly that lives in the forest and emits a short and powerful light like a flash.

list.author: Tibor Litauszki
list.title: The Journey of a Moth
list.description: To keep track of the flight, I used an LED headlight. So that the twilight effect is in the background, so I chose multi-exposure inside the camera.

list.author: Fabio Saltarelli
list.title: Stalking
list.description: Scene where a specimen of Elephant Seal defends her calf from the stalking of a striated caracara in the Falkland Islands.

list.author: Jenny Zhao
list.title: Giraffe Drinking
list.description: Low angle shot of a giraffe drinking at a waterhole, accompanied by an oxpecker. Zimanga Private Game Reserve, South Africa.

list.author: Tibor Litauszki
list.title: Between the Stars
list.description: I photographed this moment underwater. I was able to do it by putting my camera in an underwater case, attaching it to a metal weight and placing it all under the eggs. I waited nearby for it to be dark, and when the newt appeared, I lit it with an LED lamp. I started the camera with a home-made wired remote release. It turned out 1-2 sharp pictures.

list.author: Hermis Haridas
list.title: Dawn's Whispers: Graceful Hoopoe Silhouette at Sunrise
list.description: A Hoopoe took flight with its wings spread in a smooth motion across the canvas of the early-morning sky that was illuminated by the sunrise's bright hues. I saw that this bird would occasionally grab its prey in the air and other times on the ground. Additionally, I observed that each time it caught its prey, it flew in the same direction to a nearby tree.​

list.author: Agnieszka Wieczorek
list.title: Living inside the yellow fields
list.description: Inspired by yellow colour I decided to take a photo with a drone showing an aerial perspective of a small settlement of the city of Swidnica, Poland, which was built in the middle of a field. In the spring months the buildings are surrounded by beautiful rapeseed fields.​

list.author: Neelutpaul Barua
list.title: Magadi Airshow
list.description: The alkaline Lake Magadi provides breathtaking patterns on the surface of the lake to photograph flamingos. Lake Magadi, Kenya 12 Sept, 2023.

list.author: Derek Robertson
list.title: Black and White
list.description: Drone photo of a creek during a snowstorm, Salisbury Mills, New York

list.author: Maman Sukirman
list.title: Freshwater Fish Farming
list.description: Freshwater fish farming area at Lake Balang Tonjong, Antang Village, Manggala District, Makassar. Freshwater fish farming is a form of animal husbandry that produces fish as a source of animal protein that is beneficial for human health.​

list.author: Mostafijur Rahman Nasim, Bangladesh
list.title: Home bound
list.description: Bangladesh is a densely populated country. The scenario of public transport changes during Eid festival as people leave Dhaka in over crowded transports. In the photo, huge crowded launches (water vessels) are seen in Sadarghat launch terminal in Dhaka. People took position on the roof of the river trucks.

list.author: Grzegorz Długosz​
list.title: Busy Builder
list.description: A penduline tit builds its unique nest in the marshes of Biebrza National Park, Poland. The male is shown leaving the nest to bring more material to finish up the build.

list.author: Mike Krehbiel
list.title: Peek-a-Boo
list.description: This lesser prairie chicken (Tympanuchus pallidicinctus) image was taken in western Kansas. I was in a blind overlooking a lek on April 1, 2023. It was a cold morning and by the time the activity died down enough to exit the blind I was shivering. I wasn't sure if it was due to the cold or the excitement of getting an opportunity to witness the non-stop activity of the prairie chicken.​

list.author: Juan Jose Murillo​
list.title: Golondrinas
list.description: These pretty golondrinas (Hirundo rustica) rest on the power lines.

list.author: Mario Labado​
list.title: Sandhill Crane mama feeding colts
list.description: I saw this sandhill crane mama feeding its colts. Taken April 8, 2023 in Gainesville, Florida.

list.author: Petr Bambousek​
list.title: Gannet Colony
list.description: The giant cliffs that line the shores of the archipelago are home to a variety of attractive bird species. Probably the most spectacular colonies are those of the northern gannets (Morus bassanus). In this photo I tried to capture as best I could just the unique environment of the terrier colonies with the typical combination of strong winds and rough seas.

list.author: Raphael Alves
list.title: Stranded
list.description: Euridice Castro, 33, holds her nephew Otavio, in the window, while her son Aquiles plays in the rising rivers, in Anama, Brazil on May 24, 2021. Anama has been an "amphibian city" for years. Without work, adults stay at home most of the time; children, without classes and without public leisure spaces, are left playing in the flooded areas.​

list.author: Mustafa Binol
list.title: Farmland
list.description: Although this is actually an irrigable land, it became dehydrated due to the decrease in the water level as a result of excessive water use. The vehicle, which has deep well drilling equipment, is about to start work to dig a new and deeper well on the land below, which has become ineffective. We must have water for a healthy future with conscious agriculture.​

list.author: Luisa Lynch Harris
list.title: Our Saviors
list.description: In Tenerife on August 16, 2023 the largest fire in Spain was declared. For days we watched the mountains burn behind our houses. This photo taken from behind my house shows the importance of firefighting services, including helicopters, which were essential to control and extinguish the flames. This photograph was taken from the town of Santa Úrsula on August 27, 2023.​

list.author: Adra Pallón
list.title: Fire and Ashes
list.description: Several firemen working directly against the advancing fire in the largest fire in the history of Galicia, Spain, one of the regions with the highest number of forest fires in Europe. After several days the fire was still out of control. According to EFFIS (European Forest Fire Information System) data on fire seasons, 2022 has been the worst year of the century.​

list.author: Jeanny Tang
list.title: Dry Fish Pond
list.description: The holes dug by fish for spawning can be seen after the pond has dried up.​ Tai Sang Wai, Yuen Long, Hong Kong

list.author: Alan Taylor​
list.title: A Cool Drink
list.description: A bull elk stopping in the Oconaluftee River in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park to a refreshing drink

list.author: Rubens Rebouças
list.title: O Pé de Garças
list.description: A small island with a tree welcomes a flock of herons every evening, who come from far away to rest for the night until they leave again the next morning. The image was taken at a small lagoon in Uberlândia, Minas Gerais, Brazil.

list.author: Jorge Castro Urbiola
list.title: Axolotl
list.description: (Ambystoma velasci) The beauty of a river monster. In spite of finding water levels well below normal, drought and lack of rain, this salamander may choose to be a salamander and walk away, if the water stress continues. They are organisms highly adapted to natural conditions, I am very impressed. San Luis Potosi, Mexico.​

list.author: Gianluca Gianferrari​
list.title: Flooding
list.description: Po is the largest river in Italy. In the past, the floods have always been the cause of great damage and decades ago embankments were built to contain them. Due to climate change, these floods are increasingly rare. During the last flood I took this photo of the semi-submerged birches. I chose a long exposure to get a watercolor effect in the reflection on the water. A warning of nature​.

list.author: Benjamin Salb
list.title: Wolf Spider Mama
list.description: This image is a 129 frame focus bracket of a wolf spider with her babies. I encountered her in the middle of an asphalt path during an early morning macro outing this summer. You can usually expect some movement from the kids, which could ruin a stack attempt, but they were all completely still for this set.

list.author: Soumya Ranjan Bhattacharyya​
list.title: Galaxies at my Feet
list.description: A yellow leafhopper came and sat on a spore dispersing bracket fungus. It stayed there until the fungul spore dispersal gained pace. I captured this moment inside the moist deciduous forest of Goa in India.​

list.author: 雷 波 / Lei Bo
list.title: Love Follows
list.description: Butterflies chasing under the setting sun at Nankun Mountain, Guangzhou, China.

list.author: Tibor Litauszki
list.title: A Graceful Flight
list.description: An antlion flies in the summer night in Hungary's Kiskunság steppe. To show the dynamics of the movement, I chose a long shutter speed. I followed it with an LED light, I set the focus to manual. The flash flashed on the second shutter. Only a few sharp pictures turned out.​

list.author: Jaime Daniel Fajardo Torres​
list.title: Terrifying Geometry
list.description: This is a species of spider known as ogre spiders, of the genus Deinopis. The photograph was taken at night in the middle of a mature forest in northern Ecuador in the tropical rainforest of the Ecuadorian Chocó, a place considered a hotspot. The spider photographed was generating its egg sac with its own web.​

list.author: Alessandro Carboni​
list.title: Sound and Vision
list.description: This picture represents one the most intense moments I could remember during my life. It was September, when after a two-week wait I was lucky enough to experience an amazing mix of extraordinary elements, which I will never forget: the impressive display of the autumn colours at their peak and the first snow of the season.​

list.author: Roberto Valdez​
list.title: Cotopaxi Volcano from the Antisana Glaciers
list.description: After several hours of ascending and navigating the vast crevasses of the Antisana volcano's glacier, as the first rays of sunlight began to shine, I spotted the illuminated Cotopaxi in the distance with a massive column of steam rising from it. I carefully positioned myself between crevasses, pulled out my camera, and took the shot with a slow shutter speed, trying my best.

list.author: Adam Mowery
list.title: Fruits of Labor
list.description: Prickly pear cactus fruits at the base of El Capitan at sunset, Guadalupe National Park, Texas.

list.author: Cosmin Ovidiu Stan
list.title: Dreamland
list.description: An image made in the Apuseni Mountains, mountains that are part of the Western Carpathians. I witnessed a special sunrise seen from Poiana Calineasa towards the Poiana Horea - Belis area. Wild forests under the warm sunlight. The image was made on May 1, 2023.​

list.author: Bruce Hogle
list.title: Planned Burn at Chase State Fishing Lake
list.description: This is the late evening on April 17, 2014 with the planned pasture burn creeping along the ridge of the hill at the end of the lake. The evening was cool and got downright chilly by 1:30 AM when we finally quit photographing. Driving back from a ranch outside Elmdale, KS, I spotted the red glow, which looked like there might be a chance it would be reflecting in the lake, and it was!​

list.author: Siddhartha Ghosh​
list.title: Wolf Trinity
list.description: Here you can see three wolves leaping through the air showcasing their enthusiasm and companionship. It's like a moment in time that captures their nature in the wild. Each wolf exudes happiness and energy with their eyes shining bright from the excitement and their strong bond as a pack. This image serves as a reminder of the elegance and charm of these animals, in their natural environment.

list.author: HJ Yang
list.title: Morning Attack
list.description: An orca attacks two seals in the morning on the beach.

list.author: Luisa Pericoli
list.title: Shaking Off
list.description: Free yourself. The bear.

list.author: Bing Lin
list.title: Rainy Rendezvous
list.description: A drenched adult male gelada monkey looks on by the cliff edge in a moment of tranquility during a thunderous rainstorm at Guassa, 12,000 feet above sea level, deep in the  Ethiopian highlands. Incessant downpours in the rainy season often resulted in rain splatters on my camera lens, soaked habitats and lots of wet fur, all pictured here.

list.author: Estebane Rezkallah
list.title: The Rangiroa Gang
list.description: These dolphins jumped and played in front of our boat as we crossed Rangiroa, the largest of the Tuamotu Atolls and the second largest in the world. The dolphins play in the waves with each ship that passes by.

list.author: Bambang Wirawan
list.title: Ocean Guard Sea Tribe
list.description: The sea tribe in Alor, East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia are wise people; their commitment to protecting the surrounding sea is truly extraordinary. Using simple equipment they catch fish only according to their food needs and the rest they sell in the market.

list.author: Giovanni Allievi
list.title: Rough Sea 12
list.description: A sea wave charges towards the shore during a fierce storm. For two decades, I've dedicated myself to documenting the mesmerizing spectacle of ocean waves crashing on the shore. This ongoing project is a visual ode to the sea's enduring allure, a diary of its ever-changing moods. Varigotti, Italy.

list.author: Michael Hegyi
list.title: Wildebeest Breakfast Balloon Safari
list.description: A small troupe of wild blue wildebeest (Connochaetes taurinus) watches from a safe distance as a hot air balloon lands on the Maasai Mara, spills out its breakfast safari tourists and deflates. Maasai Mara National Park, Kenya. July 2018.

list.author: Mano Aliczki
list.title: Walking Over Wildlife
list.description: A gray heron (Ardea cinerea) perches in a pond in an urban park in Budapest, Hungary as people walk by; the bird went unnoticed by most of the passers-by, just as we often do not generally notice the creatures living around us in the city. However, we do not need to leave the city to meet wildlife. If we slow down, we can see how many living creatures we share our habitat with.

list.author: Randall Hudson
list.title: Startled!
list.description: Lightning evokes a primal response at a motel along the northern shore of Lake Superior.

list.author: Narayan Malu
list.title: Fighter Jets
list.description: I was lucky to capture these two male tigers fighting in the air. Taken in Tadoba Tiger Reserve, India​.

list.author: Fatih Yilmaz
list.title: Dusty Ride
list.description: In Anatolia, Turkey, people engage in animal husbandry for their livelihood. After a harsh winter, the valleys overflow with lush grass, but it is not easy to reach this food source in rough terrain. The shepherds and their flocks, who walk 10 km every day to the foot of Mount Nemrut, leave behind a dusty story of their journey.

list.author: Md. Safayet Hossain Shanto
list.title: Floating Guava Market
list.description: The floating guava vendor collects and sells his fruit by boat; the guava market is crowded every year during monsoon. The vendor’s income goes to support his family, including education for boys and girls. Atghar Kuriana, Swarupkathi, Barishal, Bangladesh.

list.author: Jose Pereyra Lucena​
list.title: SER*ES - Lunático
list.description: El Cardón, venerated by the native peoples of northwestern Argentina, surrounded by myths and legends. It is impossible not to be absorbed by its strange beauty. A direct shot on a winter moonlit night.​ Province of Salta, Argentina, 2021

list.author: Vittorio Ricci
list.title: Lost in Snow Waves
list.description: A lonely conifer tree in Dolomites highlands in winter time, Fanes-Sennes-Braies Regional Natural Park, Italy.

list.author: Ashley Sykes
list.title: Ghost Mushrooms
list.description: This is a group of ghost mushrooms, Omphalotus nidiformis. They grow and then disappear quickly on warm nights after a few rainy days, particularly on rotting and decaying tree stumps in coastal forests. This clump I photographed was in a coastal woodland area in Gerroa, New South Wales, Australia. March 21, 2022.​

list.author: Gero Heine
list.title: Bright yellow patches of quaking aspen trees are broken by curving stands of lodge pole pines.
list.description: Burn scars reveal lines and curves of lodge pole pines, broken up by patches of quaking aspens in their fall color display, forming an almost abstract pattern. I took this image in northwest Glacier National Park with a medium telephoto lens to "flatten" the scene to let the peripheral vision wander.​

list.author: Mohammed Salman
list.title: Orange Mushrooms
list.description: Orange mushrooms growing out of a dead bark on the forest floor, fruiting bodies of delicate fungi.

list.author: Irina Petrova Adamatzky​
list.title: Alien Portrait
list.description: In this photograph, the intricate skin of a Corn Snake (Pantherophis guttatus) is showcased in a unique way, using ultraviolet light. Scientifically proven, snakeskin exhibits a glowing effect under ultraviolet light, a phenomenon that herpetologists have utilized since the late 20th century to locate snakes in the dark.

list.author: Petr Bambousek
list.title: Hourglass Frog
list.description: (Dendropsophus ebraccatus) I found this beautiful frog resting at the edge of a flower in the garden of my hotel in Costa Rica. I used the decorative lights from the opposite building as background, and a subtle diffused flash to lighten the frog. EXIF: OM System OM-1, OM System 90mm/3.5 IS, ISO 640, f/3.5, 1/40s, tripod, diffused flash​.

list.author: Joseph Mullica
list.title: Scarlet Kingsnake
list.description: A scarlet kingsnake (Lampropeltis elapsoides) climbing down a pine tree presumably hunting lizards at dusk.

list.author: Sergio Emmanuel Comisso
list.title: El Cantante
list.description: This common toad sings in his pond to attract females, and at the same time, warn his opponents that the pond belongs to him, through the waves generated by the vibrations caused by his throat. Cordoba, Argentina.

list.author: Christian Passeri
list.title: Attack
list.description: An African bullfrog (Pyxicephalus adspersus) attacks a rival in an attempt to defend its mating territory. These big frogs congregate in shallow waters during rain season, where they fight in order to be able to mate with the females. During the few hours I spent observing them, the dominant male, as seen in the picture, was defending the middle of the water puddle from all his rivals, attacking them one by one.​

list.author: Russell Laman
list.title: Phantoms Adrift
list.description: Pacific sea nettles (Chrysaora fuscescens) swarm in the murky waters off Monterey, California. August 2021.

list.author: Cai Jialing
list.title: Snowy Night
list.description: Following the Taal Volcano eruption in the Philippines in early 2020, ocean sediments were stirred up into the water column. During a blackwater dive in Batangas Bay, I encountered a female paper nautilus hitchhiking on floating debris. The particles around it reflected my flashlight, resembling falling snowflakes. Rather than depicting post-disaster chaos, the scene created a serene fairytale.

list.author: Daniel Nicholson
list.title: Parting the Tide
list.description: A grey reef shark parts the tide of a bait ball in the shallows of the Ningaloo Reef. This was a once in a lifetime experience, as millions of small fish were gathered together and forced into the narrow alleys of a shallow coral reef by hunting predators. This photo was taken inside the baitball, as a shark burst out, hunting its next mouthful of fish.

list.author: Juan Carlos Huitrón Baca
list.title: Living Texture
list.description: Macro photo of a hard coral of the genus Mycetophyllia. Guatemala is not well known for its coral reefs and yet they have very interesting corals around Cabo Tres Puntas. This coral was found at 12 meters depth.​ Cabo Tres Puntas, Guatemala, March 2023.
